TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter extends System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricSignatureFormatter

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is used to create a digital signature using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSA> algorithm.
Use <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureDeformatter> to verify digital signatures with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSA> algorithm.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a PKCS #1 version 1.5 signature.
[!code-csharp[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatterExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsapkcs1signatureformatterexample/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatterExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsapkcs1signatureformatterexample/vb/program.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter.SetKey%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter.SetHashAlgorithm%2A> to set the key and hash algorithm before calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter.CreateSignature%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm key) cil managed

Docs.param: The instance of the algorithm that holds the private key.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter.SetHashAlgorithm%2A> to set the hash algorithm before calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter.CreateSignature%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance unsigned int8[] CreateSignature(unsigned int8[] rgbHash) cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates the PKCS #1 signature for the specified data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You must specify a key and a hash algorithm before calling this method.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a PKCS #1 version 1.5 signature.
[!code-csharp[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatterExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsapkcs1signatureformatterexample/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatterExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.security.cryptography.rsapkcs1signatureformatterexample/vb/program.vb#1)]

Docs.exception:
The key is .
-or-
The hash algorithm is .

Docs.param: The name of the hash algorithm to use for creating the signature.
Docs.summary: Sets the hash algorithm to use for creating the signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You must set a hash algorithm before calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter.CreateSignature%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetKey(class System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm key) cil managed

Docs.param: The instance of the algorithm that holds the private key.
Docs.summary: Sets the private key to use for creating the signature.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You must set a key before calling <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.RSAPKCS1SignatureFormatter.CreateSignature%2A>.
